All Games > Indie Games > Contagion
Community Hub
Contagion
Contagion isn't your average Zombie Shooter but instead takes a more realistic and different approach to the popular genre with unique characters, environments, weapons, items, and a built in system that makes every round completely unpredictable with resources, objectives, and paths ever changing.
User reviews: Mostly Positive (9,636 reviews) - 75% of the 9,636 user reviews for this game are positive.
Release Date: Oct 25, 2013

Recent updates View all (203)

November 4

Post-Halloween Update

Hello Contagion fans!

We hope you had a fun Halloween, hopefully filled with more treats than tricks. Over here on Team Contagion we have been hammering away on another update. The big one here is restoring the maps to their non-scary pre-Halloween versions, albeit with a handful of fixes sprinkled into them here and there.

We've also addressed a recent crashing issue that was brought to light by our newest map, Montclair. Although it seemed to be possible in any map, it was most prevalent there. The fix involved optimizing how zombies are removed (well, specifically, some zombies were not being removed when they should have been). If you have been having crashing issues ever since the last patch, you definitely want to check things out now.

Hunted has been slightly modified as well. Now when you ping another survivors phone, nearby zombies will be attracted to the sound. We're hoping this should spice up all things hunted a little bit, as we've been having a lot of fun with it. We've also increased the radius that your phone can "see" other player's phones to accommodate the play style of larger maps.

There's lots more coming down the pipe, so keep your eyes pealed for more updates!

Also, just for anyone who hasen't seen it yet, don't forget to check out the soundtrack:



The sale may be over, but it's still a pretty hot deal for $1.99 in my opinion. I know I am biased, but really, check it out if you like the music in the game. There's a lot of stuff in the soundtrack that isn't in the game (yet!), and its all very good music. Plus, it's got that fantastic track from the trailer! I've run the numbers, and it's statistically improbable for you to lose on this deal.



Thanks again everyone, see you next time!

-The Contagion Team

29 comments Read more

October 31

Halloween hotfix!

Happy Halloween!

Got a small hotfix coming out soon that should address a number of issues that came up with the recent patch. It wouldn't be game development if fixing one thing didn't break 3 more! Anyway, the important bits of the changelog is as follows:

- Added cvar to turn off pumpkins on zombies: allow_zombie_holiday. 0 for off and 1 for on. 1 is default for Halloween.
- fixed stealth melee kill bugs related to the zombie pumpkin heads
- numerous bugfixes and tweaks to ce_montclair
- fixed shortcut exploit in ce_barlowsquare


We know there are still a few more issues floating around but we are working hard to get them ironed out. In the mean time, we wanted to quickly get out an update with what we are able to fix now.

All of us at Monochrome hope that everyone has a great Halloween, and if you are going out trick-or-treating, going to a party, and/or participating in anything "cool" [ed. note: staying at home and playing videogames is cool, I don't care what anyone says], please stay safe and have fun!

-The Contagion Team



24 comments Read more

About This Game


What they're saying about Contagion

"Contagion aims to save the zombie game genre from itself" -GamesBeat
"Contagion does have a small role to play in the great gaming zombie apocalypse. I quite like it." -RockPaperShotgun
"Contagion is a gory, addictive horror game that’s well worth its $20 price tag" -Bloody-Disgusting
"Contagion presents a tense survival based horror game" -Canadian Online Gamers
"Barlowe Square is one of the best levels featured in a multiplayer game" -Hooked Gamers

Dynamic Gameplay

- Each play through is never the same with our built-in randomization system that changes the game/round each time you play!

State Of The Art Gore

- Our advanced gibbing system will immerse you into the game with limbs and organs being blown or hacked off!

Immersive Sound Effects

- Realistic ambient and sound effects that instantly draw you into the games dark apocalyptic atmosphere!

Traditional Zombies

- Slow moving undead that can only be truly laid to rest with a bullet to the brain or enough wasted lead in their body wasting away the ability to function.

Extensive Survival Equipment

- Over 28 vital pieces of equipment from a large selection of firearms, melee weapons, don't forget explosives, support items, tools, and much more to be added!

Unique Game Modes

- Choose from a multitude of classic and new game-modes that require co-op and survival skills in which you escape, extract civilians or hunt each other! Not to mention our Panic modes, upcoming Flatline (Survival) mode and more!

Stop paying more

- We will be releasing new content and 2 DLC Bundles in 2014... For Free! This was decided in 2010. Once you own Contagion you will never have to pay for updates or DLC bundles we develop for it... Ever.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows® 7 32/64-bit / Vista 32/64 / XP 32/64
    • Processor: 2.4 GHz Intel Dual Core Processor
    • Memory: 4 GB RAM
    • Graphics: DirectX® 9 compatible video card with 256 MB, Shader model 2.0. ATI X800, NVidia 6600 or better
    • DirectX®: 9.0c
    • Hard Drive: 7 GB HDD Space
    • Sound: DirectX 9.0c Compatible
    • Hardware: Mouse & Keyboard
    • Other Requirements: Broadband Internet Connection
    Recommended:
    • OS: Windows® 7 64-bit / Vista 64-bit / XP 32/64
    • Processor: 2.4 GHz Intel Dual Core Processor
    • Memory: 8 GB RAM
    • Graphics: DirectX® 9 compatible video card with 512 MB, Shader model 3.0. ATI X1600, NVidia 7600 or better
    • DirectX®: 9.0c
    • Hard Drive: 7 GB HDD Space
    • Sound: DirectX 9.0c Compatible
    • Hardware: Mouse & Keyboard
    • Other Requirements: Broadband Internet Connection

に ち Harmless に ち
196 products in account
3 reviews
Recommended
44.4 hrs on record
Posted: July 28
Ok so- I own this game. I have owned it a while. I enjoy it. But there's a ton of people posting negative reviews for stupid reasons. Up to and including: - Shooting zombies is very ineffective unless it's the head (Yes someone actually posted this). I think too many people compare it to Left 4 dead and other similar games and it's a different experience. People also are complaining about the devs responses, when they leave up posts calling thier game outright trash, ect. ect. . I enjoy coop games, I really enjoyed SWAT 4, I enjoy Left 4 Dead, Payday, and I enjoy this. That being said here's a realistic pro / con list for you:

Pro
-Co oP is fun-
You need to share ammo. You need to share weapons. Health kits are super rare and you have to arbitrate who they go to. You have to work together.

-Immersion-
Rage zombies were never my thing. Nothing against them but to me the slow shambling ones are the way it's done. If your a fan of oldschool zombie movies- There ya go. It's got that feel to it. Voice acting-A lot of work went into this. It's not stellar by any means but there are two radials with different sayings for most of them. Top that off the characters will be louder or quiet based on certain factors (If the person is crouching or havent done any movements yet - the voice of character will be quieter than usual. If character took a shot or someone near by shot - they will speak loud. They will also speak loud when they were running for quite long time or there is action going on). If someone goes down, they become a zombie and can call the horde and hunt down thier former friends. I always had a lot of fun with it and it helps with the immersion which is a big thing in games for me.

-Modes-
There are a fair number of modes for this game. I look at some of the games coming out nowadays like Evolve (Don't get me wrong I enjoy it, I play it, but it was too much for what it was) that are essentially one game mode stretched to thin. The same could be said about a lot of games, some would say it about this one, but at least they tried. I tested some of the other ones, none were as much fun as coop.

Con
-The graphics are dated-
This isn't a deal breaker for me but it is for a lot of people "OMARGAWRD THUR GRUAFAX".

-The Co-op is unintuitive-
It's true, there's not going to be any Left 4 Dead highlighting of objectives. You have a cell phone that you check that tells you where to go / what to do. You have to actually figure it out for yourselfs, i.e. where the basement is, where the helipad (the roof) is, and so on. To the devs, this would really be my only gripe. Some things are easy to figure out, others can feel absurd. Play the police station and try finding keys the first time, you'll probably get the idea. I had friends drop this game just based on the fact they were tired of running around, sometimes dying because we couldn't find some objective. If you intend on playing coop, and new to the map- look up a guide of the map. You'll thank me. I'm not saying the Dev's should implement highlights, but something a little more informative with messages would vastly improve this game imho.

-Not really a SinglePlayer Experience-
The story will be the same regardless, nothing grandiose. Just the same mission or surviving alone. This game is meant to be played with friends. I have heard that there are griefers online, and people have complained about it in the reviews. There are griefers in any multiplayer experience. It's not the dev's fault. Seen it in Ark, Seen it in Payday, Seen it in Left 4 Dead, Seen it- You get the idea. Hell any survival game with limited resources is begging to be griefed. So- Play with friends if it bothers you, or find a good coop server. I have personally never had the issue of running into griefers on this as of yet, but have only played on online servers a handful of times. Those times I did, people were greedy with ammo, and weapons, but didn't grief.

All this being said, I would reccommend this game. There's still some things that could be added that could improve it, but if you're a fan of old school zombie movies like I am, then get it. Maybe wait till it goes on sale if the price tag is too high for you, but worse case scenario - If you don't like it well good news everyone steam has a return policy now. But play it with friends. All games are more fun that way, especially this one.

Beeyun

Recommended
24.6 hrs on record
Posted: May 21
Note: I had given this game a negative review after playing it for about 5 or 6 hours initially.

I feel this game is hit or miss as a whole; it is not for everyone. It's really important to know what kind of zombie game this is before going in a game and expecting fast paced zombie killing. It is entirely a mix of fast paced zombie shooters mixed with the occasional waiting around to hold out.

If you are the type of player who enjoy constant shoot'em ups not having to worry about an ammo count and slashing your way through thousands of zombies... then go play Left 4 Dead. This game is not for you.
However, if you enjoy games that require teamwork, conserving ammo, scavenging for supplies and using the limited resources around you then you should give this game a shot.

I have found that the community in this game is alarmingly small, but the players have been surprisingly nice. The few that do play regularly will go out of their way to help newer players to expand and enlarge the community with more people.

Every gun and melee in the game has a certain feel to it, and I guarantee there will be at least one that can cater to your liking. The zombies lack a little diversity when it comes to the aesthetics, but have pretty unique ways of moving around and sneaking up on the survivors making gameplay pretty interesting in the long run. PvP mode is available which creates an even more intense and horror-filled experience added to the gameplay.

And hey, there's free DLC coming with this game soon... so that's always a plus.

Paying $20 for this game still does seem a little pricey to me, the amount of content offered seems to fall a little short of the price. Maybe buy the game when it goes on sale. Contagion really favors a more strategic crowd when it comes to fighting zombies, includes mature players and pretty decent graphics for a HL2 modification overall.

steven_feeney
33 products in account
3 reviews
Not Recommended
84.7 hrs on record
Posted: August 4
I have been a long term Contagion gamer so feel qualified to write a fairly unbiased review.

TL;DR Each of the reviews you see below praising the game but critcising the developers are accurate. It is that simple. Also, team killing is rife which completely destroys the gameplay and forces individuals to use the easier non-TK servers which quickly become boring. The developers have also taken no action against the numerous trolls who use certain choke points in the levels to ensure that gamplay is stopped. The game community is almost completely extinct largely due to the developers shocking attitude to their customers.

LR; When I first started playing Contagion last year the Developers were embroiled in a lengthy update process. The community was disnechfranchised including certain individuals who had supported via Kickstarter and were still waiting on rewards. I decided to let that slide and decide for myself.

The gameplay is good with tense moments and very acceptable graphics using the CS engine. To the developers credit some of the levels are huge, the biggest in the Steam library by some estimates. Nice use of fire and shadow makes for interesting human versus zombie battles.

Once killed a human player becomes a zombie and must attack and kill/turn the remaining human survivors. However this creates a unique dynamic because once killed you drop your weapons and ammo. Players naturally want certain weapons or more ammunition and team kill individuals to get it which forces the majority of the community to use non-TK servers which are far easier to beat because the zombies and objectives are easier to achieve with more abundant ammo.

Zombies are blessed with the ability to track humans, summon NPC zombies and direct zombie hordes. Quite often the zombie players win if they are experienced and know how to ambush. However if the humans are experienced then becoming a zombie is chore because the humans bunch at choke points...due to the fact that once a zombie is killed a certain number of times they become a spectator to the game. So experienced players simply find an alley/corridor and wait. They kill zombie attackers over and over forced into the alley until they become spectators then continue with the objectives. The only way to win is hope that a new player is within the crowd and will make a mistake leading a gap in the team.

Because of the dev attitude, the team killing and the trolling, the game's user base has dwindled and you will often see the same 10-20 people hopping between servers some of which alleviate their boredom through trolling the levels to make them uncompletable. Examples include stopping people from using critical elevators or preventing NPC characters from being rescued by leading them away from the exit zones.

Unofrtunately the user base has also dwindled in part due to the shocking attitude of the developer Tatsur0. I had read numerous reviews on Steam and on the gaming press about his attitude to paying customers but disregarded them. However as the updates dragged out from weeks to months to over 9 months it was hard to accept his constant refutations to customers. In the end a bug-riddled update was issued with new maps but missing promised weapons, skins and game modes which are apparently "coming soon". The developer response on the forums is always "I promise nothing" and "Go play other games."

People who criticised the developers were continually banned whilst trolls and team killers cannot be dealt with unless you supply video-evidence to the developers.

During my supportive period I even wrote a lengthy strategy for the developers (I have launched several apps and work in App Development) about how to really engage the audience during updates and prevent users leaving. It was so well received some of the gamers even said I should be hired. The post was ignored with a response "We don't have time to do any of that stuff." I shrugged that off and continued to pour time into the forums and the game.

My decision to exit the game came after Tatsur0 refused to acknowledge the fact that Windows 10 renders the game unplayable (no sound, stuttering). After I flagged this and asked how many users were planning to take advantage of the free Windows upgrade my topic was flagged as spam (under the heading "Not relevant to Contagion") and the response was

"Users know we don't support Windows 10 so Valve handle refunds."

I cannot in good faith recommend that new users devote any kind of time to a game whose community has almost disappeared despite being a pretty good game.

I honestly hope the Developers learn how to deliver a better customer service experience to the community that keep them in business.
